fullText: Emma Pittman and Brody Grant in 'The Outsiders' (Photo: Matthew Murphy) The Outsiders sparkles not just as a smart adaptation of the beloved S.E. Hinton novel (and Francis Ford Coppola movie) but a genuinely great American musical. The songs here, by the indie folk duo Jamestown Revival (with Justin Levine) don’t feel like pro forma music breaks but organic engines driving a tragic story of class conflict and brotherly love to onstage moments with real heft. Plus, the score boasts a country-inflected energy and lyrics that match the plainspoken poetry of Robert Frost. Who says that nothing gold can stay? You can read my full review in the June/July issue of Musicals magazine. THE OUTSIDERSJacobs Theatre, BroadwayRunning time: 2 hours, 25 minutes (with 1 intermission)Tickets on sale through January 2, 2026 Best theater of 2024, from ‘Maybe Happy Ending’ to ‘Oh, Mary!’December 19, 2024In "Theater" Broadway looks back in anguish on a season with few box office winnersDecember 26, 2024In "Theater" ‘White Girl in Danger’ (Off Broadway review)April 10, 2023In "Theater" Save my name, email, and website in this browser for the next time I comment.
